issues.title: Implement Vuex store for notification state management
issues.description: Current notification handling uses direct IPC communication and event-based updates. While it supports simple notification functionality, it would benefit from a centralized Vuex store for more complex notification state management, consistency, and easier state access across components.
acceptance_criteria: Create a Vuex store module for notifications (store/modules/notifications.js)
Move notification state management from event-based to store-based approach
Ensure all notification components use the store instead of direct IPC events
Maintain existing notification functionality during transition
Add tests for notification store mutations and actions

issues.title: Consolidate and clarify IPC communication patterns
issues.description: The preload script exposes two communication objects: 'api' (generic send/receive with whitelisted channels) and 'electron' (large number of direct invokers and specific event listeners). The 'electron' object is the predominant pattern, while 'api' appears underutilized or from an older pattern. This creates confusion about which pattern to use.
acceptance_criteria: Audit all IPC communication patterns in the codebase
Decide on a single, consistent IPC pattern for the application
Document the chosen pattern in AGENTS.md or developer documentation
Refactor code to use the consistent pattern throughout
Remove or update the unused pattern documentation

issues.title: Detect system notification permissions status
issues.description: Users need to enable system notifications manually in OS settings (e.g., macOS System Settings). The app should detect if notifications are enabled and provide in-app guidance to users when notifications are disabled.
acceptance_criteria: Implement API to check system notification permission status
Display user-friendly message in settings when notifications are disabled
Provide direct link/button to open system notification settings
Support macOS, Windows, and Linux platforms
Add documentation for notification permission requirements

issues.title: Implement task dependency selection UI
issues.description: When creating or editing a task, users should be able to select dependencies from a dropdown with checkboxes. Selected dependencies become prerequisites that must be completed before the task can be started.
acceptance_criteria: Add dependency selector component to task creation/edit form
Display available tasks as checkboxes in searchable dropdown
Show dependency relationships visually (e.g., task ordering indicators)
Prevent circular dependencies in validation logic
Auto-order tasks based on dependency completion status
Update task list to show dependency relationships

issues.title: Design and implement task recurrence functionality
issues.description: Tasks need to support recurring patterns (daily, weekly, monthly, etc.). While the database has a recurrence_rules table, the recurrence logic and UI are not yet implemented.
acceptance_criteria: Design recurrence rule data structure and UI pattern
Create recurrence configuration component in task form
Implement recurrence engine for generating recurring task instances
Handle edge cases (skipped periods, end dates, max occurrences)
Integrate recurrence with AI natural language parsing
Add tests for recurrence generation logic

issues.title: Review and fix ipcMain.emit usage in notification service
issues.description: The sendNotification function in app/src/services/notification.js uses ipcMain.emit for inter-process communication. It's recommended to use webContents.send for sending messages to the renderer process, as ipcMain.emit may not properly reach the renderer.
acceptance_criteria: Review all ipcMain.emit calls in notification.js
Replace with webContents.send where appropriate
Test notifications still work correctly after changes
Document the correct IPC pattern for future developers

issues.title: Handle notification scheduling edge cases
issues.description: The notification scheduling mechanism needs to handle edge cases gracefully: system clock changes (backward/forward), app restarts/crashes, and system sleep/wake cycles.
acceptance_criteria: Implement clock change detection and notification rescheduling
Persist scheduled notifications and restore on app startup
Handle system sleep/wake events for pending notifications
Add tests for edge case scenarios
Log notification scheduling events for debugging

issues.title: Improve error handling in project service
issues.description: The project service (app/src/services/project.js) needs more specific error handling for database operations to provide better debugging information and user feedback.
acceptance_criteria: Add try-catch blocks for all database operations
Provide specific error messages for different failure types
Log errors with sufficient context for debugging
Return user-friendly error messages to the UI
Add error handling tests

issues.title: Improve data validation in task service
issues.description: The task service (app/src/services/task.js) needs improved data validation, especially for date and time formats, to prevent invalid data from being stored in the database.
acceptance_criteria: Add validation for all task properties (dates, times, priorities)
Use a consistent date/time format throughout the application
Validate date ranges (due_date must be after created_at)
Add validation tests for task creation and updates
Document validation rules in developer documentation

issues.title: Prevent circular dependencies in task and notification services
issues.description: There's a potential for circular dependencies between task.js and notification.js when deleting tasks and associated notifications. This needs to be resolved to prevent runtime errors.
acceptance_criteria: Analyze and document the dependency chain between services
Refactor to eliminate circular dependencies
Ensure task deletion properly cleans up notifications without circular calls
Add tests to prevent regression of circular dependencies
Document the proper pattern for cross-service operations

issues.title: Separate main process and renderer process concerns
issues.description: The main process (app/electron.js) and IPC handlers import modules under app/src/services/*, blurring the boundary between main and renderer concerns. This complicates bundling/testing, especially where renderer-only utilities (e.g., window.logger) are referenced.
acceptance_criteria: Audit all imports from app/src/services/* in main process files
Move shared business logic to a location accessible by both processes
Create main-specific service layer for IPC handlers
Ensure renderer-only utilities are not referenced in main process
Add tests for main process service layer
Update AGENTS.md with clear separation guidance

issues.title: Fix mixed module system and logger selection in services
issues.description: Several services attempt to use require(...) inside ESM modules (e.g., app/src/services/task.js, app/src/services/project.js, app/src/services/dataIntegrity.js). In Node ESM, require is not defined; the catch path falls back to console.*, undermining the project's own logging standard.
acceptance_criteria: Audit all services for require() usage in ESM modules
Replace dynamic require() with proper ESM imports
Ensure all services use the project's logger consistently
Remove console.* fallbacks after proper import is established
Add linting rules to prevent require() in ESM files
Test logging in all affected services

issues.title: Fix UI routing mismatch in NotificationListener component
issues.description: app/src/components/system/NotificationListener.vue attempts to route to { name: 'project' }, but the router only defines Home and Settings (app/src/router/index.js). This is either stale code or an incomplete feature.
acceptance_criteria: Determine if project route is needed or if code is stale
If needed: add project route to router configuration
If not needed: remove or update the routing logic in NotificationListener
Verify all router references throughout the codebase
Add tests for notification-triggered navigation

issues.title: Fix Vuex action API misuse in tasks module
issues.description: fetchTasksByProject in app/src/store/modules/tasks.js has a non-standard signature (context, projectId, { fetchAll } = {}). Vuex only passes a single payload argument, so the third parameter is never provided; fetchAllTasksByProject attempts to pass a third argument via dispatch, which Vuex interprets as dispatch options (not payload). This makes 'fetch all vs. recent' per-project behavior unreliable.
acceptance_criteria: Refactor fetchTasksByProject to use standard Vuex action signature
Pass fetchAll as part of the payload object instead of separate argument
Update all dispatch calls to fetchTasksByProject accordingly
Add tests verifying fetchAll behavior works correctly
Audit other Vuex actions for similar API misuse
Document correct Vuex action patterns in AGENTS.md

issues.title: Refactor monolithic functionHandlers.js module
issues.description: app/electron-main/functionHandlers.js is a monolith with multiple responsibilities (validation/parsing/filtering/formatting/tool dispatch). This will become harder to safely extend as more AI functions are added.
acceptance_criteria: Analyze current responsibilities in functionHandlers.js
Separate validation logic into dedicated module
Separate parsing logic into dedicated module
Separate filtering/formatting logic into utilities
Keep only tool dispatch orchestration in functionHandlers
Add tests for each extracted module
Update AGENTS.md with new structure

issues.title: Reduce verbose logging in hot paths
issues.description: Task/AI query handlers log extensive per-entity information (e.g., due dates for every task). This hurts performance and increases privacy risk (logs contain personal task content).
acceptance_criteria: Audit all logging in task and AI query handlers
Reduce verbosity of per-entity logging in hot paths
Implement log levels (debug, info, warn, error)
Strip or redact sensitive personal content from logs
Add toggle for debug logging in development

acceptance_criteria: Research E2E testing approach for Electron (e.g., Spectron, Playwright)
